name: Introduction to Anthropology
description: This course provides an overview of the discipline of Anthropology, with a focus on the four sub-disciplines: physical anthropology, archaeology, linguistics, and cultural anthropology.

name: Biological Anthropology
description: This course covers the biological aspects of human behavior, including genetics, evolutionary theory, ecology, primatology, and the biological basis of human behavior.

name: Archaeology
description: This course examines the methods and techniques of archaeological research, including fieldwork, laboratory analysis, and interpretation of material culture.

name: Introduction to Medical Anthropology
description: This course introduces students to the study of health, illness, and healing in cross-cultural perspective. Topics include medical pluralism, the social construction of health and illness, medical systems, and the cultural and social aspects of healing.

name: Anthropology of Health and Illness
description: This course examines the social, cultural, and political aspects of health and illness. Topics include the social construction of illness, epidemiology, and the politics of health care.

name: Medical Anthropology in Practice
description: This course focuses on the practical applications of medical anthropology. Topics include public health, community health, and the development of culturally appropriate health interventions.
